localize.title: Buzzing on Reddit
localize.description: See what's buzzing on Reddit in your native language

blogPost.title: I no longer trust The Great Suspender
blogPost.author: davidfstr

previous.excerpt:
So it keeps going up and up. And the people that have been buying it keep
getting higher and higher unrealized gains.

How are they going to sell it though? And to who? If the hedge funds that had
shorted have bought the shares (or will, in the future, end up buying them all)
despite the loss,…
previous.title: How are the (lucky) people that bought GME going to sell that?

localize.title: 买了GME的（幸运的）人怎么卖？
localize.the_new_excerpt:
所以它一直在涨，一直在涨。而那些一直在买它的人继续
越来越高的未实现收益。

不过他们要怎么卖呢？又卖给谁呢？如果对冲基金，有
空头已经买入了股票（或在未来，最终将全部买入）。
虽败犹荣

localize.title: 買了GME的（幸運的）人怎麼賣？
localize.the_new_excerpt:
所以它一直在漲，一直在漲。而那些一直在買它的人繼續
越來越高的未實現收益。

不過他們要怎麼賣呢？又賣給誰呢？如果對沖基金，有
空頭已經買入了股票（或在未來，最終將全部買入）。
雖敗猶榮

next.title:
The bottom 50% of Americans own 1% of the stock market. 

The events of this week are about this as much as anything else. https://t.co/CfG8S5Otl7

localize.full_text:
底层50%的美国人拥有1%的股市。

本周发生的事件和其他任何事情一样，都是关于这个问题。https://t.co/CfG8S5Otl7。

底層50%的美國人擁有1%的股市。

本週發生的事件和其他任何事情一樣，都是關於這個問題。https://t.co/CfG8S5Otl7。
